Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AaeAP1a (AaeAP1 analog, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, scorpions, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (73.68%) toAaeAP1K: 26%, I=L: 16%, V=F: 11%.Activity: Active against S. aurerus (MIC 4 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC 16 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 4 ug/ml). Also inhibited four human cancer cell lines, H460, MB435s, MCF-7 and PC3 at ~10 uM.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: 100% hemolysis at 32 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Du Q, Hou X, Wang L, Zhang Y, Xi X, Wang H, Zhou M, Duan J, Wei M, Chen T, Shaw C. 2015
Literature Information.Title: AaeAP1 and AaeAP2: novel antimicrobial peptides from the venom of the scorpion, Androctonus aeneas: structural characterisation, molecular cloning of biosynthetic precursor-encoding cDNAs and engineering of analogues with enhanced antimicrobial and anticancer activities.
